channel.title: Interleaved RSS Feed
channel.description: This is an interleaved feed of the most recent entries from each RSS source, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: China Investors' Newest Craze: Saudi Stocks
item.description: Chinese investors are piling into new funds tracking Saudi Arabian equities, a sign of the robust appetite for overseas exposure at a time when home m...

item.title: Tech selloff erases $1.1 trillion of ‘Magnificent Seven’ market cap in five days
item.description: The seven Big Tech companies collectively shed more than $500 billion in market cap on Wednesday alone.

item.title: Goldman Sachs Opens Up an Investment Strategy Once Reserved for the Wealthy
item.description: Bank plans to offer everyday customers of the robo-adviser Betterment investment portfolios designed to help them save money on taxes.

item.title: Infosys meets earnings estimate as sales edge past consensus
item.description: Indian outsourcing giant Infosys reported growing profits as it forecast a slight pickup in sales growth for the year.

item.title: Tech Shares Log Worst Day of 2024
item.description: A drop in Magnificent Seven shares helped send the Nasdaq Composite down 2.8%, its biggest one-day decline since December 2022.

item.title: Slowdown in U.K. jobs market could pave way for BoE interest rate cut, Deutsche Bank says
item.description: The Office for National Statistics data shows a slowdown in the U.K.’s labor market that could see the Bank of England cut interest rates at its upcom...

item.title: HSBC Names Georges Elhedery as Chief Executive
item.description: Georges Elhedery, who has spent two decades at the bank, will take over as CEO after the lender unexpectedly said earlier this year that Noel Quinn wo...

item.title: ‘I’m not jealous — just genuinely curious’: How can a woman work from home and mind her 3-year-old child at the same time?
item.description: “What do you all think about employees who work from home and have little kids to watch at the same time?”

item.title: U.S. Crude Oil Inventories Fall for Third Straight Week
item.description: U.S. crude oil inventories fell by 4.9 million barrels, in a surprise third consecutive week of declines, while stocks of gasoline and distillates inc...

item.title: A Trump-Vance victory should be bearish for the dollar and Treasurys
item.description: A Donald Trump victory in the race for the White House, and a Republican sweep of both houses of Congress, should logically be bearish for the U.S. do...
